title: Toronto lockdown - one of the world's longest?
description: What is the effect of one of the longest pandemic indoor-dining bans in the world?

title: Bob Dylan: 80 things you may not know about him on his 80th birthday
description: A look back at the life and career of the influential and now-octogenarian singer-songwriter.

title: The couple who met on YouTube
description: Australian Anitha Kannan and Ian Chalmers, from the UK, met over YouTube and bonded over social anxiety in lockdown.

title: Pollution: ‘We can smell and taste the traffic at school'
description: A primary school in Manchester sits on one of Europe's busiest roads where particle pollution levels exceed WHO limits.

title: George Floyd death: How do I talk to my son about race?
description: A year on from the death of George Floyd, BBC presenter Eddie Nestor examines his role as a father.

title: Former miner: Why I’m giving up my coal fire
description: Stan Renton and his wife Audrey, have been heating their home with coal for their entire married lives.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How Liverpool sealed Champions League qualification
description: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Ian Wright look at Liverpool's "magnificent" form in their last 10 Premier League games that sealed Champions League qualification.

title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

title: BBC's reputation highly damaged by Diana interview report, says Patel
description: The report into the 1995 Diana interview is a "significant moment" for the BBC, home secretary says.

title: Coronavirus: Patel denies No 10 pursued herd immunity policy
description: The home secretary rejects a claim by ex-aide Dominic Cummings that ministers wanted the virus to spread.

title: Glasgow Covid level may drop if ICU numbers do not rise
description: The health secretary says restrictions in the city could ease if intensive care numbers do not go up.

title: New border scheme aims to make UK safer
description: People coming to the country without a visa or immigration status will need a permit, the government says.

title: Covid: Pfizer and AstraZeneca jabs effective against Indian variant - study
description: They are effective against symptomatic disease but protection is low after only one dose, a study says.

title: Damiano David: Eurovision winner denies taking drugs
description: The lead singer of winning Italian band Måneskin denies taking cocaine after online claims.

title: Israel-Gaza: A conflict on pause as both sides claim victory
description: Morale among supporters of Gaza's armed groups remains intact after the 11-day conflict with Israel.

title: Kate Garraway: 'My husband is devastated by Covid'
description: The TV presenter says Derek Draper still "can't really move" after coming home from hospital.

title: Mount Nyiragongo: DR Congo residents flee as volcano erupts
description: Thousands flee the city of Goma as nearby Mount Nyiragongo throws huge lava fountains into the air.

title: Lisa Shaw: BBC Radio Newcastle presenter dies aged 44
description: The 44-year-old daytime presenter loved being on air and was "cherished by many", her family says.

title: China ultramarathon: Severe weather kills 21 runners
description: Freezing rain and winds hit a long-distance race in a mountainous tourist site in China.

title: In pictures: DR Congo's Mount Nyiragongo erupts, sparking mass evacuation
description: Thousands flee their homes in the Democratic Republic of Congo after a volcano erupts near Goma city.

title: Whatever happened to Peter the Armenian cook?
description: The search for the mysterious man behind a cult Edinburgh restaurant who disappeared a decade ago.

title: Fury signs Wilder contract as fight agreed for 24 July
description: Tyson Fury signs his contract to face Deontay Wilder for a third time on 24 July.

title: ‘I have dementia, but I’m still here, I’m still me’
description: Chris Higgins was diagnosed with dementia in lockdown after his wife noticed a change in his behaviour.

title: History-making Taylor wants USA superstar Crawford next after unifying light-welterweight division
description: Josh Taylor says he wants a fight with American superstar Terence Crawford next after he beats Jose Ramirez to unify the light-welterweight division.

title: The Papers: Jab beats variant and BBC review to be widened
description: New data showing vaccines are effective against the Indian variant is among Sunday's front-page stories.

title: Glastonbury live-stream delivers a rush of nostalgia in the face of failure
description: The concert brought back fond memories, despite technical problems disrupting the live-stream.

title: Eurovision 2021 in pictures: The best of the ceremony
description: A look at some of the acts who performed on stage at this year's show in Rotterdam.

title: Pregnancy after baby loss: 'We felt guilty for being excited'
description: After losing their son hours after he was born, Iona and Luke had mixed emotions about getting pregnant again.

title: Jon Cruddas: Labour guru's plan to win back the working class
description: Veteran Labour thinker Jon Cruddas says the answer to the party's woes is staring it in the face.

title: Italy wins Eurovision: 'Rock and roll never dies'
description: Italy's Måneskin have won the Eurovision Song Contest 2021 with their entry, Zitti e Buoni.

title: History-chasing Mickelson takes one-shot lead into US PGA's final round
description: Phil Mickelson takes a one-shot lead into the final round of the US PGA Championship as he bids to become the oldest major winner.
